clinical_study.brief_title: Lactobacillus Reuteri for Prevention of Necrotizing Enterocolitis in Very Low-birth Weight Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Role Of Lactobacillus Reuteri in Preventing Necrotizing Enterocolitis in Very Low Birth Weight Infants

lead_sponsor.agency: Zekai Tahir Burak Women's Health Research and Education Hospital

clinical_study.source: Zekai Tahir Burak Women's Health Research and Education Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Probiotics are favorable microorganisms that regulate the flora of the gastrointestinal system and stimulate the immune system. Necrotizing enterocolitis incidence is 10-25% in newborn infants whose birth weights are < 1500 g. Although bifidobacterium and other lactobacilli spp. have been used to reduce the incidence of necrotizing enterocolitis in clinical trials, Lactobacillus reuteri has not been used in the prevention of necrotizing enterocolitis in very low birth weight infants yet. The objective of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of orally administered Lactobacillus reuteri in reducing the incidence and severity of necrotizing enterocolitis in very low birth weight infants.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of Lactobacillus reuteri on necrotizing enterocolitis in VLBW infants
primary_outcome.description: NEC diagnosis will make modified Bell's criteria. Grade 1A will not include in NEC group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of Lactobacillus reuteri on culture proved sepsis
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with culture positivity will accept as proven sepsis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of Lactobacillus reuteri on weight gain
secondary_outcome.description: The infants will be weight daily on scales that will calibrated weekly.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of Lactobacillus reuteri on length of hospital stay
secondary_outcome.description: Specified length of hospital stay as days

arm_group.description: Lactobacillus reuteri 100 million CFU/day for 3 months

intervention.description: Lactobacillus reuteri 100 million CFU/day for 3 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Very low birth weight infants < 1500 gr
- Gestational age < 32 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Genetic anomalies
- Short bowel syndrome
- Not willing to participate
- Allergy to Lactobacillus reuteri components
